title: Prompt Processing Visualization
oneLiner: Visualize how a user prompt is processed into tokens and embeddings
description: Visualize how a user prompt is tokenized at multiple levels—characters, words, or phrases—and how each token is assigned a relative weight based on its importance. Show the semantic relationships between these tokens by projecting them into an embedding space. Additionally, external data retrieved by the system can be mapped into the same space, showing which external sources were used and how they relate to the user’s original input.

secondaryImages.text: This image shows the initial tokenization of the prompt into words.
This image visualizes how the prompt is processed into embeddings.
This image demonstrates how external data sources were integrated.

title: Interactive Prompt
oneLiner: Make the prompt interactive to enable fine-tuning
description: Detect operators or variables in the user prompt and replace them with UI elements. It can be used to introduce other possible options or fine-tuning the prompt (e.g. giving different weights).

title: Weighted Parameter
oneLiner: Replacing variables in the prompt with interactive UI elements
description: Add interactive data visualizations of parameters and let users adjust their weights. The image takes an example of the attention weight of each token in user prompt.

title: Data Toggle
oneLiner: Show the segment of source data that AI retrieved and give an option to include or exclude it
description: Show the segment of source data that AI retrieved and give an option to include or exclude it.

title: Constrained Input
oneLiner: Limit the types of user inputs for higher performance
description: Ask users to give specific types of inputs so that the AI system can ensure more accurate outputs. If any, think about how each variable depend on each other.

secondaryImages.text: This image demonstrates how input types can be constrained.
This image shows how input constraints lead to optimized output.

title: Probabilistic Menu
oneLiner: Give different menu items and sort them based on the context
description: Ask users to give specific types of inputs so that the AI system can ensure more accurate outputs. If any, think about how each variable depend on each other.

title: Dynamic Data Visualization
description: Enable users to tailor the data visualization to their interests and needs by changing measures or adjusting units.

secondaryImages.text: This image shows how users can dynamically adjust data measures.
This image demonstrates fine-tuning of data visualizations.

title: Granular Data Exploration
oneLiner: Enables users to ask further questions about the data
description: Enables users to ask further questions about a certain data to understand the underlying factors behind them or broader context around them.

secondaryImages.text: This image shows deeper exploration of specific data points.

title: Algorithmic Process
oneLiner: Show the underlying algorithmic process rather than only showing the final outputs
description: Show the underlying algorithmic process rather than only showing the final outputs. Focus on what is most valuable for users to understand, and in what manner. Also think about options for users to further investigate, adjust the parameters or override algorithmic decisions.

title: Data Expression Generation
oneLiner: Change the unit or generate different expressions of the data
description: Change the unit of the data or generate additional explanations to make the data more relatable.
